alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:15AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RAINFALL TO CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL... After a brief break overnight, rain will return to Southcentral Tuesday morning and continue through Tuesday night before tapering to scattered showers for Wednesday morning. Expected additional rainfall amounts through Tuesday night: Anchorage Bowl: 0.50" to 0.75" Matanuska Valley: 0.50" to 0.75" Western Kenai Peninsula: 0.10" to 0.25" Eastern Kenai Peninsula: 0.25" to 0.50" Whittier and Portage Valley: 0.5" to 0.75" Additional storm systems will move across Southcentral Alaska through the rest of the week. Widespread rain is also expected Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning and again late Thursday into Friday. This additional rain could push small streams and creeks to or slightly above bankfull. Smaller rivers could see water levels rise to bankfull. Water levels along larger rivers are expected to remain below bankfull. In the Anchorage area, Chester Creek and Campbell Creek are expected to reach bankfull. The Kenai River is expected to remain at bankfull through the week as heavy rain works its way down into the river. In urban areas, ponding of water and localized flooding on poorly drained roadways is also possible. Please use caution when driving or when recreating along or on area waterways. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
